page.title: 14Brereton Heath Park.
page.content: Brereton Heath Park is one of the {principal leisure areas}in our vicinity,for the pleasure of hundreds and to the consternation of some of the local population.Eighty acres of woodland,water and heath make-up this site,which owes its presence to the {Ice-Age}when melting water from retreating ice sheets left large quantities of sand in the area. Sand which was quarried until 1973 when it had been worked out.The land was bought in 1981 and a year later the park was created. During the summer months hundreds of people use the park for a{variety of {pursuits}Fishing,canoeing,wind-surfing are sports allowed on the lake but many go swimming which is not advisable due to underwater weeds and the depth of water at the centre of the lake.
